email_group_1.subject: Updated Benefits Handbook
email_group_1.desc: Hello team, we have published the updated benefits handbook for the new plan year. It outlines medical, dental, FSA/HSA details, and the refreshed parental leave policy. Please review the attached PDF at your convenience and contact HR if any clarifications are needed. No acknowledgment is required.
email_group_1.explain: Legitimate HR communication with a normal PDF and no undue urgency.

email_group_1.subject: Action Required: Benefits Verification
email_group_1.desc: Your benefits enrollment needs urgent verification. Open the attached file and run the verification tool. Failure to do so within 24 hours may result in loss of coverage.
email_group_1.explain: Lookalike domain and executable disguised as PDF; false urgency.

email_group_2.subject: Payroll Adjustment Confirmed
email_group_2.desc: This confirms your approved payroll adjustment for last cycle. The change will reflect on your next payslip. No further action is required.
email_group_2.explain: Informational payroll update with no links or attachments.

email_group_2.subject: Salary Discrepancy Report
email_group_2.desc: We detected a discrepancy in your salary disbursement. Download and open the attached file to confirm your bank details immediately.
email_group_2.explain: Spoofed domain and malicious attachment requesting sensitive action.

email_group_3.subject: Team Offsite Travel Agenda
email_group_3.desc: Attached is the finalized travel agenda and hotel information for next week’s offsite. Please verify your flight times and reach out with any conflicts.
email_group_3.explain: Legitimate internal travel details with a normal PDF.

email_group_3.subject: Urgent Travel Invoice Issue
email_group_3.desc: Your recent travel invoice could not be processed. Open the attached tool to correct the invoice immediately to avoid non-reimbursement.
email_group_3.explain: Lookalike domain and executable masked as a PDF.

email_group_4.subject: Security Awareness Session Invitation
email_group_4.desc: You are invited to the quarterly security awareness session on Friday at 2:00 PM. Topics include MFA best practices, phishing patterns, and reporting procedures.
email_group_4.explain: Expected IT notice; no suspicious links or files.

email_group_4.subject: Password Policy Violation
email_group_4.desc: Your password violates our policy. Click this link to reset immediately: http://securemailling.com/reset-now
email_group_4.explain: Spoofed domain and unsafe HTTP link urging immediate reset.

email_group_5.subject: Office Maintenance Schedule
email_group_5.desc: Facilities will perform routine HVAC maintenance this weekend. Please shut down workstations and secure personal items before leaving Friday.
email_group_5.explain: Routine facilities notice with no risky asks.

email_group_5.subject: Building Access Confirmation Needed
email_group_5.desc: To keep your badge active, open the attached access form and complete the verification today.
email_group_5.explain: Misspelled sender and executable file; false urgency.

email_group_6.subject: Client Webinar Invitation
email_group_6.desc: Join us next week for a client webinar covering product updates and customer success stories. Please RSVP by Thursday.
email_group_6.explain: Standard internal event invite; no dangerous content.

email_group_6.subject: Claim Your Webinar Reward
email_group_6.desc: Congratulations! You have earned a reward. Open the attached file and follow the instructions to redeem.
email_group_6.explain: Lookalike domain substitution and malicious attachment.

email_group_7.subject: VPN Token Auto-Renewal
email_group_7.desc: Your VPN token will renew automatically on Friday. No action is required unless you changed devices recently.
email_group_7.explain: Informational IT notice; no links or files.

email_group_7.subject: Immediate VPN Token Update
email_group_7.desc: Your VPN token expires today. Open the attached update tool and reauthenticate now to avoid access loss.

email_group_8.subject: Internal Audit Reminder
email_group_8.desc: Reminder: The quarterly internal audit begins Monday. Ensure statements and reconciliations are up to date by end of week.
email_group_8.explain: Normal audit reminder with no dangerous asks.

email_group_8.subject: Audit Discrepancy Notice
email_group_8.desc: We found mismatches in your Q2 account. Open the attached file and verify line items immediately.
email_group_8.explain: Lookalike domain and executable attachment pushing urgency.

email_group_9.subject: Performance Review Meeting
email_group_9.desc: Please find the attached agenda for your upcoming performance review. Come prepared with your accomplishments and goals.
email_group_9.explain: Internal review agenda with a benign PDF.

email_group_9.subject: Review Self-Assessment Required
email_group_9.desc: Your self-assessment is overdue. Open the attached file, complete it, and send back by end of day.

email_group_10.subject: Updated Cybersecurity Handbook
email_group_10.desc: We have updated the cybersecurity handbook to include new guidance on phishing and device hardening. Please review the attached PDF.
email_group_10.explain: Legitimate security guidance with a normal PDF.

email_group_10.subject: Mandatory Security Upgrade
email_group_10.desc: IT requires all staff to run the attached upgrade tool immediately to stay compliant. Execute the file and confirm completion.
email_group_10.explain: External domain and executable attachment; unrealistic IT request.

email_group_11.subject: Diversity & Inclusion Survey
email_group_11.desc: Please consider completing the annual D&I survey. Your anonymous feedback helps us improve programs and policies.

email_group_11.subject: New D&I Report Attached
email_group_11.desc: Open the attached report and confirm receipt before 5 PM today.
email_group_11.explain: Numeric substitution in domain and malicious attachment.

email_group_12.subject: Expense Claim Approved
email_group_12.desc: Your expense claim from July 10 has been approved. Reimbursement will be included in the next payroll cycle.

email_group_12.subject: Expense Review Needed
email_group_12.desc: We noticed inconsistencies in your recent claim. Download the attached file to confirm your details.
email_group_12.explain: Lookalike domain (I/l) and executable disguised as a PDF.

email_group_13.subject: Team Event Photos
email_group_13.desc: We compiled photos from last week’s outing. Enjoy the attached PDF album and share your favorites.
email_group_13.explain: Benign internal share with safe PDF.

email_group_13.subject: Access Your Photos Securely
email_group_13.desc: To access your photos, open the attached encrypted file and log in with your company credentials.
email_group_13.explain: Lookalike domain and credential-stealing attempt via executable.

email_group_14.subject: Parking Permit Renewal
email_group_14.desc: Your parking permit expires next month. Please renew via the employee portal before the 25th to avoid disruption.
email_group_14.explain: Expected facilities reminder with proper process.

email_group_14.subject: Parking Violation Fee
email_group_14.desc: A fee has been issued to your vehicle. Open the attached invoice and pay immediately to prevent escalation.
email_group_14.explain: External pay domain and executable attachment.

email_group_15.subject: Knowledge Base Refresh
email_group_15.desc: We reorganized the internal knowledge base for easier navigation. Access it via the intranet as usual.

email_group_15.subject: Portal Login Needed
email_group_15.desc: Your portal access expired. Click this link to revalidate immediately: http://knowledgelink-support.com/login
email_group_15.explain: Fake support domain and insecure link requesting login.

email_group_16.subject: August Company Newsletter
email_group_16.desc: The latest newsletter covers sustainability progress, customer wins, and upcoming events. See attached PDF for the full issue.
email_group_16.explain: Usual comms with a benign attachment.

email_group_16.subject: Company Update File (Mandatory)
email_group_16.desc: Management requires that all employees open and acknowledge the attached update today.
email_group_16.explain: Lookalike domain and malicious double extension.

email_group_17.subject: Helpdesk Ticket Closed
email_group_17.desc: Your ticket regarding the printer queue has been resolved. Reply if you still experience issues.

email_group_17.subject: Confirm Ticket Closure
email_group_17.desc: Open the attached log to confirm closure. This action is mandatory to finalize the ticket.
email_group_17.explain: Lookalike domain using uppercase I and executable attachment.

email_group_18.subject: Holiday Party RSVP
email_group_18.desc: You’re invited to our annual holiday celebration! Please RSVP by Friday so we can finalize catering.

email_group_18.subject: Gift Card Enrollment
email_group_18.desc: Claim your $100 gift card by opening the attached file and submitting your details.

email_group_19.subject: Okta MFA Tips
email_group_19.desc: Reminder: Use the Okta Verify app for MFA. If you switch phones, enroll your new device immediately from the security portal.

email_group_19.subject: Okta Credential Reset File
email_group_19.desc: Your Okta credentials have been locked. Run the attached helper to restore access.
email_group_19.explain: Unusual file execution requirement and external helper.

email_group_20.subject: Q3 Goals & Metrics
email_group_20.desc: Attached are your updated Q3 goals, priorities, and success metrics. Please review and come prepared to discuss in our 1:1 next week.
email_group_20.explain: Manager communication with a benign PDF.

email_group_20.subject: Immediate KPI Review Required
email_group_20.desc: Open the attached KPI review tool and submit your credentials to confirm your performance metrics today.

email_group_21.subject: Annual Performance Review Schedule
email_group_21.desc: Dear Employee, We are pleased to inform you that the annual performance review process will begin next month. Please find attached the schedule for your review. Make sure to prepare your self-assessment by the due date. If you have any questions, feel free to reach out. Best, HR Team.
email_group_21.explain: The email is from HR with a legitimate attachment regarding performance reviews.

email_group_21.subject: Urgent: Update Your Payroll Information
email_group_21.desc: Dear Employee, We need you to update your payroll information immediately to avoid any disruptions in your payments. Click the link below to access the update form. Thank you, Payroll Department.
email_group_21.explain: The email requests sensitive information and contains an executable attachment, which is a red flag.

email_group_22.subject: Quarterly Budget Review Meeting
email_group_22.desc: Hello Team, Please find attached the budget report for the upcoming quarterly review meeting. Review the document before our meeting next week. Let's ensure we are all prepared to discuss the key points. Regards, Finance Team.
email_group_22.explain: The email is from the finance department with a relevant attachment for a meeting.

email_group_22.subject: Your Invoice is Ready
email_group_22.desc: Dear Employee, Your latest invoice is ready for download. Please find the attachment and make sure to review it as soon as possible. Failure to do so may result in late fees. Regards, Billing Department.
email_group_22.explain: The email includes an executable attachment disguised as an invoice, which is suspicious.

email_group_23.subject: IT Security Awareness Training
email_group_23.desc: Dear Team, As part of our ongoing efforts to enhance security awareness, we are conducting a training session next month. Attached is the training material for your review. Please read through it before the session. Best, Security Team.
email_group_23.explain: The email promotes a training session with a legitimate PDF attachment.

email_group_23.subject: Important: Verify Your Account Now
email_group_23.desc: Dear User, We have detected unusual activity on your account. To secure your information, please verify your account by downloading the attached form. Thank you, Support Team.
email_group_23.explain: The email creates urgency and includes a malicious executable attachment.

email_group_24.subject: Facilities Maintenance Update
email_group_24.desc: Hello Everyone, We have scheduled maintenance for several facilities next week. Attached is the maintenance schedule. Please plan accordingly and let us know if you have any questions. Regards, Facilities Team.
email_group_24.explain: The email provides information about maintenance with a relevant attachment.

email_group_24.subject: Action Required: Confirm Your Details
email_group_24.desc: Dear Employee, We need you to confirm your personal details to keep our records up to date. Please download the attached document and follow the instructions. Thank you, Admin.
email_group_24.explain: The email requests personal information and has a suspicious executable attachment.

email_group_25.subject: Travel Policy Update
email_group_25.desc: Dear Team, We have updated our travel policy to better accommodate our employees. Please find the updated policy attached for your review. If you have any questions, feel free to reach out. Best, Travel Department.
email_group_25.explain: The email contains a legitimate attachment regarding company policy.

email_group_25.subject: Claim Your Bonus Now!
email_group_25.desc: Dear Employee, Congratulations! You have been selected for a bonus. Claim it by downloading the attached form and submitting it immediately. Regards, HR Team.
email_group_25.explain: The email promises a bonus and includes a harmful executable attachment.

email_group_26.subject: Important Update on Your Benefits
email_group_26.desc: Dear Employee, We are excited to inform you about some updates to our benefits package that will take effect next month. Please review the attached document for detailed information. If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to the HR department. Best regards, HR Team.
email_group_26.explain: The email provides relevant information about employee benefits and includes a legitimate attachment.

email_group_26.subject: Urgent: Action Required on Your Account
email_group_26.desc: Dear User, We have detected unusual activity on your account. To secure your information, please download the attached file and follow the instructions. Failure to do so may result in account suspension. Regards, Support Team.
email_group_26.explain: The email creates a sense of urgency and includes a suspicious executable attachment, indicating a phishing attempt.

email_group_27.subject: Quarterly Financial Report
email_group_27.desc: Hello Team, Attached is the quarterly financial report for your review. Please take a moment to go through it and let me know if you have any questions. Thank you, Finance Department.
email_group_27.explain: The email shares a standard financial report with a safe PDF attachment.

email_group_27.subject: Invoice Due: Immediate Payment Required
email_group_27.desc: Dear Customer, Your invoice is overdue. Please find the attached document and make the payment immediately to avoid late fees. Thank you, Billing Department.
email_group_27.explain: The email pressures the recipient to act quickly and includes a dangerous executable attachment.

email_group_28.subject: New Training Session Available
email_group_28.desc: Hi Team, We are pleased to announce a new training session on professional development. Please find the schedule attached. We encourage everyone to participate. Best, Training Team.
email_group_28.explain: The email promotes a training session with a legitimate PDF attachment.

email_group_28.subject: Security Alert: Update Required
email_group_28.desc: Dear Employee, Our security system has identified a potential threat. Please download the attached file to update your credentials immediately. Failure to comply may lead to account lockout. Regards, Security Team.
email_group_28.explain: The email uses fear tactics and includes a harmful executable attachment, indicating a phishing attempt.

email_group_29.subject: Facilities Maintenance Schedule
email_group_29.desc: Dear All, Attached is the maintenance schedule for the upcoming month. Please review it and let us know if you have any concerns. Thank you, Facilities Management.
email_group_29.explain: The email shares a maintenance schedule with a safe PDF attachment.

email_group_29.subject: Your Account Has Been Compromised
email_group_29.desc: Dear User, We have detected that your account may have been compromised. Please download the attached file to secure your account. Failure to do so will result in permanent deletion. Sincerely, Admin Team.
email_group_29.explain: The email creates panic and includes a malicious executable attachment, which is typical of phishing.

email_group_30.subject: Travel Itinerary Confirmation
email_group_30.desc: Hello, Your travel itinerary for the upcoming business trip is attached. Please review it and let me know if you have any questions. Safe travels! Regards, Travel Department.
email_group_30.explain: The email confirms travel arrangements and includes a legitimate PDF attachment.

email_group_30.subject: Payment Required for Your Travel Booking
email_group_30.desc: Dear Traveler, There is an outstanding payment for your recent travel booking. Please download the attached file and complete the payment to avoid cancellation. Best, Travel Team.
email_group_30.explain: The email pressures the recipient for payment and includes a harmful executable attachment.

email_group_31.subject: Quarterly Performance Review
email_group_31.desc:
Dear Team,

As we approach the end of the quarter, I wanted to remind everyone about the upcoming performance reviews. Please find attached the performance report that outlines key metrics and areas for improvement. Make sure to review it thoroughly before your one-on-one meetings.

Best,
HR Team
email_group_31.explain: The email comes from the HR department and contains a legitimate attachment related to performance review.

email_group_31.subject: Urgent: Update Your Payroll Information
email_group_31.desc:
Attention Employee,

We have noticed some discrepancies in your payroll information. Please download the attached form, fill it out, and return it to us as soon as possible to avoid any delays in your next paycheck.

Thank you,
Payroll Department
email_group_31.explain: The email requests sensitive information and includes an executable attachment, which is a common phishing tactic.

Hello Team,

As part of our ongoing efforts to enhance security, we have implemented new IT protocols. Attached is a document outlining these changes and what you need to do to comply. Please read it carefully and reach out if you have questions.

Best,
IT Department
email_group_32.explain: The email is from the IT department with a relevant attachment discussing security protocols.
